title: Feature request: support multiple url in case websites are down
body:
extend `url` to be a list of urls as opposed to a single one.

### Rationale

oftentimes fetching fails due to websites being down:
```
==> Fetching from https://ftpmirror.gnu.org/texinfo/texinfo-6.5.tar.gz failed.
==> Error: FetchError: All fetchers failed for texinfo-6.5-jfsqfa7c3igtjeirfpf3oavvmkw5v5ir
```
a simple hack is to edit the package to use an alternative source:
```
url      = "https://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/texinfo/texinfo-6.5.tar.gz"
```
A new user might not know what to do and what to edit, so it would be good to minimize such hacks.

### Description

Not sure how intrusive/diffucult is it, but Spack could support things like
```
url    = ["https://ftpmirror.gnu.org/texinfo/texinfo-6.5.tar.gz", "https://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/texinfo/texinfo-6.5.tar.gz", ....]
```

and try to use the another source in the list if fetching failed for the current one.

### Additional information

Same issue has been raised in [Google forum](https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!topic/spack/MW67IXrVA2w) and also in Slack recently.
